body:
# geojson

This shard is meant to provide a simple interface for creating, reading, and
writing geoJSON strings and objects that represent them, based on the
[GeoJSON specification](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946).

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:
```yaml
dependencies:
  geojson:
    github: respitesage/crgeojson
```
2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "geojson"
```

Once you've required the library, you can use the `GeoJSON` module to create
a geometry and a feature, like so:

```crystal
point = GeoJSON::Point.new longitude: -91.343, latitude: 0.018

feature = GeoJSON::Feature.new geometry: point, id: "Galapagos"
```

Note that this library (like the GeoJSON specification) uses positions of the
form [longitude, latitude(, optional altitude/elevation)]. This is particularly
important when not using named arguments to specify points and positions.
Additionally, the `id` field above is optional. Refer to the documentation of
`Feature.new` for more information.

Now that we have our feature, we can serialize it to GeoJSON:

```crystal
feature.to_json # => %({"type": "Feature",
                #       "geometry": {"type": "Point", "coordinates": [-91.343, 0.018]},
                #       "id": "Galapagos"})
```

If we instead had that string and wanted to deserialize it into a feature, we
could do so like this:

```crystal
json_string = %({"type": "Feature",
                 "geometry": {"type": "Point", "coordinates": [-91.343, 0.018]},
                 "id": "Galapagos"})

feature = GeoJSON::Feature.from_json json_string
```

This library currently conforms with almost all of the GeoJSON Specification, so
you can also serialize, deserialize, and programmatically manipulate
FeatureCollections, MultiPoints, LineStrings, MultiLineStrings, Polygons,
MultiPolygons, and GeometryCollections.

## Development

Features still to be developed can be found in `TODO.md`. Make sure to add specs
for any new features.

## Contributing

1. Create a fork of this repository
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request from your branch to this repository

## Contributors

- Benjamin Wade - creator and maintainer

types.name: CoordinateTree
types.doc:
A `CoordinateTree` is a standard tree structure in which there is a defined,
parent-less `Root`, intermediate `Branch` nodes, and `Leaf` nodes which have
floating-point values and lack children.
types.summary: A CoordinateTree is a standard tree structure in which there is a defined, parent-less Root, intermediate Branch nodes, and Leaf nodes which have floating-point values and lack children.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `CoordinateTree` structure based on the given *parser*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new CoordinateTree structure based on the given parser.

instance_methods.name: leaf_value
instance_methods.doc:
Gets the leaf value of this `CoordinateTree` node.

`CoordinateTree::Root` and `CoordinateTree::Branch` nodes will raise when
this method is called.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the leaf value of this CoordinateTree node.

types.name: Branch
types.doc:
A `CoordinateTree::Branch` is an intermediate node in a `CoordinateTree`
structure. It has children and a parent but no leaf value.
types.summary: A CoordinateTree::Branch is an intermediate node in a CoordinateTree structure.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Branch` as a child of *parent* based on *parser*. This
constructor assumes that the *parser* is positioned at the beginning of
an array in a GeoJSON coordinate string.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Branch as a child of parent based on parser.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Branch` with the given *parent* and adds the new `Branch`
as a child of *parent*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Branch with the given parent and adds the new Branch as a child of parent.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if @children == (other.@children)
else
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Iterates over this Branch's children.

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Iterates over this Branch's children.

instance_methods.name: hash
instance_methods.doc: See `Object#hash(hasher)`

instance_methods.name: leaf_value
instance_methods.doc: Raises an exception because a Branch does not have a leaf value.
instance_methods.summary: Raises an exception because a Branch does not have a leaf value.

def.name: leaf_value
def.body: raise("Branches do not have leaf values!")

types.name: Leaf
types.doc:
A `CoordinateTree::Leaf` is a terminal node in a `CoordinateTree`
structure. It has a parent and a leaf value but no children.
types.summary: A CoordinateTree::Leaf is a terminal node in a CoordinateTree structure.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Leaf` with the given *parent* and *leaf_value* and adds
the new `Branch` as a child of *parent*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Leaf with the given parent and leaf_value and adds the new Branch as a child of parent.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Leaf` as a child of *parent* based on *parser*. This
constructor assumes that the *parser* is positioned at the beginning of
a position array in a GeoJSON coordinate string.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Leaf as a child of parent based on parser.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if leaf_value == other.leaf_value
else
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Raises an exception because a Leaf has no children to enumerate upon.
instance_methods.summary: Raises an exception because a Leaf has no children to enumerate upon.

def.name: each
def.body: raise("Leaves have no children to enumerate!")

instance_methods.name: hash
instance_methods.doc: See `Object#hash(hasher)`

instance_methods.name: leaf_value
instance_methods.doc: The Float64 value at this Leaf

instance_methods.name: leaf_value=
instance_methods.doc: The Float64 value at this Leaf

types.name: Root
types.doc:
A `CoordinateTree::Root` is the root node of a `CoordinateTree` structure.
It has children but no parent or leaf value.
types.summary: A CoordinateTree::Root is the root node of a CoordinateTree structure.

constructors.doc:
Creates a `CoordinateTree` from the given `JSON::PullParser`. This
constructor assumes that the *parser* is positioned at the beginning of
a GeoJSON coordinate string.
constructors.summary: Creates a CoordinateTree from the given JSON::PullParser.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if @children == (other.@children)
else
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.doc: Iterates over this Root's children.

instance_methods.doc: See `Object#hash(hasher)`

instance_methods.name: leaf_value
instance_methods.doc: Raises an exception because a Root does not have a leaf value.
instance_methods.summary: Raises an exception because a Root does not have a leaf value.

def.body: raise("Roots do not have leaf values!")

types.name: LinearRing
types.doc:
A `LinearRing` is a closed set of `LineStringCoordinates`. To satisfy this
requirement, it must consist of at least four postions, and the first and
last positions must be the same.
types.summary: A LinearRing is a closed set of LineStringCoordinates.

constructors.doc: Creates new `Coordinates` backed by the given *coordinates*.
constructors.summary: Creates new Coordinates backed by the given coordinates.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `Coordinates` that is a copy of the *other* `Coordinates`.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Coordinates that is a copy of the other Coordinates.

constructors.summary: Creates a new Coordinates from the given coordinates array.

constructors.summary: Creates new Coordinates using the given parser.

constructors.doc:
Creates new `Coordinates` from the given *coordinate_tree*. The tree's
structure is assumed to be correct for the particular kind of
`Coordinates` that are being created.
constructors.summary: Creates new Coordinates from the given coordinate_tree.

types.name: LineStringCoordinates
types.doc:
`LineStringCoordinates` represent multiple positions connected by lines.
They must contain at least two `Position` coordinates.
types.summary: LineStringCoordinates represent multiple positions connected by lines.

Creates new `Coordinates` from the given *coordinate_tree*. The tree's

Returns true if the *other* `LineStringCoordinates` have the same

types.name: MalformedCoordinateException
types.doc:
A `MalformedCoordinateException` indicates when coordinates have been
improperly constructed or modified.
types.summary: A MalformedCoordinateException indicates when coordinates have been improperly constructed or modified.

types.name: PolyRings
types.doc:
A `PolyRings` represents a collection of `LinearRing` coordinates. There are
no validity restrictions on how many `LinearRing` coordinates may be in a
`PolyRings`.
types.summary: A PolyRings represents a collection of LinearRing coordinates.

types.name: Position
types.doc:
A `Position` represents a position on earth with a longitude, latitude, and
optional altitude/elevation (`#altivation`).

According to the GeoJSON spec, longitude and latitude are to be stored as
decimal degrees, and altitude/elevation is to be stored as a height in
meters.
types.summary: A Position represents a position on earth with a longitude, latitude, and optional altitude/elevation (#altivation).

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `Position` from the given *coordinate_tree*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Position from the given coordinate_tree.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates new `Coordinates` backed by the given *coordinates*.
constructors.summary: Creates new Coordinates backed by the given coordinates.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `Coordinates` that is a copy of the *other* `Coordinates`.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Coordinates that is a copy of the other Coordinates.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `Coordinates` from the given *coordinates* array.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Coordinates from the given coordinates array.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates new `Coordinates` using the given *parser*.
constructors.summary: Creates new Coordinates using the given parser.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Position` with the given *longitude*, *latitude*, and
*altivation*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Position with the given longitude, latitude, and altivation.
constructors.args_string: (*, longitude lon, latitude lat, altivation alt = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
if alt.nil?
  new([lon, lat])
else
  new([lon, lat, alt])
end

instance_methods.name: altivation
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the altivation (altitude or elevation) of this `Position`.

The third coordinate of this `Position` is assumed to be the altivation.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the altivation (altitude or elevation) of this Position.

instance_methods.name: latitude
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the latitude of this `Position`.

The second coordinate of this `Position` is assumed to be the latitude.

instance_methods.name: longitude
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the longitude of this `Position`.

The first coordinate of this `Position` is assumed to be the longitude.

types.name: Feature
types.doc:
A `Feature` represents a [GeoJSON Feature object](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.2)
with a geometry and properties.
types.summary: A Feature represents a GeoJSON Feature object with a geometry and properties.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `Feature` with the given *geometry*, *properties*, and *id*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Feature with the given geometry, properties, and id.

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(geometry, properties, id: id)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if type == other.type
else
  return false
end
if geometry == other.geometry
else
  return false
end
if id == other.id
else
  return false
end
if properties == other.properties
else
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: geometry
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Feature's geometry.

instance_methods.name: hash
instance_methods.doc: See `Object#hash(hasher)`

def.name: hash
def.body:
hasher = type.hash(hasher)
hasher = geometry.hash(hasher)
hasher = id.hash(hasher)
hasher = properties.hash(hasher)
hasher

instance_methods.name: id
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Feature's id.

instance_methods.name: properties
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Feature's properties.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Feature's GeoJSON type ("Feature")

types.name: FeatureCollection
types.doc:
A `FeatureCollection` represents a [GeoJSON FeatureCollection object](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.3)
and contains one or more `Feature`s.
types.summary: A FeatureCollection represents a GeoJSON FeatureCollection object and contains one or more Features.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `FeatureCollection` with the given *features*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new FeatureCollection with the given features.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if type == other.type
else
  return false
end
if features == other.features
else
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: features
instance_methods.doc: Returns this `FeatureCollections` array of features.

instance_methods.name: hash
instance_methods.doc: See `Object#hash(hasher)`

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this FeatureCollection's GeoJSON type ("FeatureCollection")

types.name: Geometry
types.doc: A `Geometry` represents a figure in geographic space.
types.summary: A Geometry represents a figure in geographic space.

class_methods.name: from_json
class_methods.doc: Creates a `Geometry` from the given GeoJSON string.
class_methods.summary: Creates a Geometry from the given GeoJSON string.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Geometry` from the given *parser*.

This static class method automatically chooses the correct
Geometry class to create.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Geometry from the given parser.

def.name: new
def.body:
geometry_type, coordinates = parse_geometry(using: parser)
if geometry_type.nil?
  raise("Type field missing!")
end
if coordinates.nil?
  raise("Coordinates missing!")
end
create_geometry(of_type: geometry_type, with: coordinates)

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if coordinates == other.coordinates
else
  return false
end
if type == other.type
else
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.doc: Gets the coordinate at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the coordinate at the given index.

instance_methods.doc: Gets the coordinate at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the coordinate at the given index.

instance_methods.name: coordinates
instance_methods.doc: Returns this Geometry's coordinates.

instance_methods.name: hash
instance_methods.doc: See `Object#hash(hasher)`

types.name: GeometryCollection
types.doc:
A `GeometryCollection` represents a collection of several geometries
(`Geometry` objects).

This class corresponds to the [GeoJSON GeometryCollection](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.8).
types.summary: A GeometryCollection represents a collection of several geometries (Geometry objects).

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `GeometryCollection` containing the given *geometries*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new GeometryCollection containing the given geometries.

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this reference is the same as other.

def.body:
if geometries == other.geometries
else
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.doc: Gets the geometry at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the geometry at the given index.

instance_methods.doc: Gets the geometry at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the geometry at the given index.

instance_methods.name: geometries
instance_methods.doc: Returns an array of the geometries in this `GeometryCollection`
instance_methods.summary: Returns an array of the geometries in this GeometryCollection

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this GeometryCollection's GeoJSON type ("GeometryCollection")

types.name: LineString
types.doc:
A `LineString` is a `Geometry` representing two or more points in geographic
space connected consecutively by lines.

This class corresponds to the [GeoJSON LineString](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.4).
types.summary: A LineString is a Geometry representing two or more points in geographic space connected consecutively by lines.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this LineString's GeoJSON type ("LineString")

types.name: MultiGeometry
types.doc:
A `MultiGeometry` is a `Geometry` corresponding to a "normal geometry" type
*T* and which can contain multiple coordinates of type *E*.
types.summary: A MultiGeometry is a Geometry corresponding to a "normal geometry" type T and which can contain multiple coordinates of type E.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new geometry with the given *coordinates*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new geometry with the given coordinates.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new geometry with the given *coordinates*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new geometry with the given coordinates.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new geometry with coordinates based on the given
*coordinate_tree*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new geometry with coordinates based on the given coordinate_tree.

instance_methods.doc: Gets a new `T` from the coordinates at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Gets a new T from the coordinates at the given index.

instance_methods.name: coordinates
instance_methods.doc: Returns an array of this geometry's coordinates.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an array of this geometry's coordinates.

types.name: MultiLineString
types.doc:
A `MultiLineString` is a `Geometry` representing several `LineString`s.

This class corresponds to the [GeoJSON MultiLineString](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.5).
types.summary: A MultiLineString is a Geometry representing several LineStrings.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this MultiLineString's GeoJSON type ("MultiLineString")

types.name: MultiPoint
types.doc:
A `MultiPoint` is a `Geometry` representing several `Point`s.

This class corresponds to the [GeoJSON MultiPoint](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.3).
types.summary: A MultiPoint is a Geometry representing several Points.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this MultiPoint's GeoJSON type ("MultiPoint")

types.name: MultiPolygon
types.doc:
A `MultiPolygon` is a `Geometry` representing several `Polygon`s.

This class corresponds to the [GeoJSON MultiPolygon](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.7).
types.summary: A MultiPolygon is a Geometry representing several Polygons.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this MultiPolygon's GeoJSON type ("MultiPolygon")

types.name: Point
types.doc:
A `Point` is a `Geometry` representing a single `Position` in geographic
space.

This class corresponds to the [GeoJSON Point](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.2).
types.summary: A Point is a Geometry representing a single Position in geographic space.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Point` at the given longitude, latitude, and
altitude/elevation (altivation).
constructors.summary: Creates a new Point at the given longitude, latitude, and altitude/elevation (altivation).
constructors.args_string: (*, longitude lon, latitude lat, altivation alt = nil)

def.name: new
def.body: new(Position.new(longitude: lon, latitude: lat, altivation: alt))

instance_methods.name: altivation
instance_methods.doc:
Gets this Point's altitude/elevation.

Technically, this positional value is meant to be the height in meters
above the WGS84 ellipsoid.

instance_methods.name: altivation
instance_methods.doc:
Gets this Point's altitude/elevation.

Technically, this positional value is meant to be the height in meters
above the WGS84 ellipsoid.

instance_methods.name: latitude
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Point's latitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.
instance_methods.summary: Gets this Point's latitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.

instance_methods.name: latitude
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Point's latitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.
instance_methods.summary: Gets this Point's latitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.

instance_methods.name: longitude
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Point's longitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.
instance_methods.summary: Gets this Point's longitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.

instance_methods.name: longitude
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Point's longitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.
instance_methods.summary: Gets this Point's longitude in decimal degrees according to WGS84.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Point's GeoJSON type ("Point")

types.name: Polygon
types.doc:
A `Polygon` is a `Geometry` representing a closed geometric figure in
geographic space with optional holes within it.

This class corresponds to the [GeoJSON Polygon](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.6).
types.summary: A Polygon is a Geometry representing a closed geometric figure in geographic space with optional holes within it.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Creates a new `Polygon` with the given *rings*.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Polygon with the given rings.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Create a new `Polygon` with an outer ring defined by the given *points* and
no holes.
constructors.summary: Create a new Polygon with an outer ring defined by the given points and no holes.

def.name: new
def.body:
begin
  if points.first == points.last
    ring = LinearRing.new(points)
  else
    ring = LinearRing.new(points.push(points.first))
  end
rescue ex_mal : MalformedCoordinateException
  if ex_mal.message == "LinearRing must have four or more points!"
    raise(MalformedCoordinateException.new("Polygon must have three or more points!"))
  else
    raise(ex_mal)
  end
end
new(PolyRings.new([ring]))

instance_methods.name: exterior
instance_methods.doc: Returns the exterior `LinearRing` of this `Polygon`

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Gets this Polygon's GeoJSON type ("Polygon")

types.name: PseudoGeometryConverter
types.doc:
A `PseudoGeometryConverter` handles deserialization and serialization of
geometry elements in GeoJSON features.
types.summary: A PseudoGeometryConverter handles deserialization and serialization of geometry elements in GeoJSON features.

class_methods.name: from_json
class_methods.doc: Creates a `Geometry` or `GeometryCollection` from the given GeoJSON string.
class_methods.summary: Creates a Geometry or GeometryCollection from the given GeoJSON string.

def.name: from_json
def.body:
element_type, contents = self.parse_pseudo_geometry(using: parser)
if element_type.nil?
  raise("Type field missing!")
end
if contents.nil?
  raise("Coordinates missing!")
end
create_pseudo_geometry(of_type: element_type, with: contents)

class_methods.name: to_json
class_methods.doc:
Serializes a `Geometry` or `GeometryCollection` by passing the *builder*
to its `#to_json` method.
class_methods.summary: Serializes a Geometry or GeometryCollection by passing the builder to its #to_json method.

def.name: new
def.body:
x = allocate
if x.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(x)
end
x

types.name: SingleGeometry
types.doc:
A `SingleGeometry` is a `Geometry` with a single `Coordinates` member of
type *T*.
types.summary: A SingleGeometry is a Geometry with a single Coordinates member of type T.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Create a new geometry with coordinates created from the given
*coordinates* array.
constructors.summary: Create a new geometry with coordinates created from the given coordinates array.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Create a new geometry from the given *coordinates* CoordinateTree.
constructors.summary: Create a new geometry from the given coordinates CoordinateTree.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Create a new geometry with the given *coordinates*.
constructors.summary: Create a new geometry with the given coordinates.

instance_methods.name: coordinates
instance_methods.doc: Returns this geometry's coordinates.
